title: Adobe Creative Cloud Suite Guide: Logging into Adobe CCS with Okta SSO
content: This document provides a step-by-step guide for logging into Adobe Creative Cloud Suite using Okta and Single Sign-On (SSO) üîê Enhanced Security with Okta SSO At Simplifi, we prioritize security by leveraging Okta SSO for accessing platforms like Adobe Creative Cloud Suite. This method offers significantly enhanced security compared to the less secure AdobeID, which relies on traditional username/password authentication. While Adobe fully supports Okta authentication, the actual login process is initiated on the Adobe side. For your convenience, an Adobe application tile is readily available on your Okta dashboard, designed to direct you straight to the login page. :steps: Steps to Log In to Adobe Creative Cloud Suite Follow these steps to securely log in to Adobe Creative Cloud Suite using your Simplifi credentials: Follow these steps to securely log in to Adobe Creative Cloud Suite using your Simplifi credentials: Access Okta Dashboard : First, log into your Okta dashboard by navigating to login.simpli.fi . Use Adobe Bookmark Tile : On your Okta dashboard, locate and click the bookmark icon tile for Adobe. This tile will take you directly to the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite login page. You should see what is a bookmark icon tile to take you directly to the login page. [Image] üëÄ Initiate Sign-In : This action will lead you to the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite home page. In the top right corner, click "Sign In." [Image] :email: Enter Simplifi Email : On the subsequent sign-in page, type your Simplifi email address into the designated field. Then, click "Continue.‚Äù [Image] üè¢ Select Company or School Account : A new page will appear. You might see a similar view or only the "Company or School Account" option. Select "Company or School Account" to proceed with the Okta authentication flow. [Image] Upon completing these steps, you should be successfully signed into your Adobe CCS dashboard, granting you full access to the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite. :troubleshooting: Troubleshooting "Invalid Credentials" Errors If you encounter an "invalid credentials" warning when attempting to log in to an Adobe application (like Adobe Creative Cloud Suite) locally, you can try the following troubleshooting steps: Open Creative Cloud Desktop App : Begin by opening the Creative Cloud desktop application. Select Help : In the desktop app menu, select "Help." Select Sign in using your browser : From the Help menu, choose "Sign in using your browser." Confirm Browser Sign-in : Select "Sign in with your browser" to open the sign-in page in your default web browser. Complete Browser Sign-in : Sign in using your browser. You may be prompted to verify with Okta if you are not already logged into Okta for the day. Return to Desktop App : After successful browser sign-in, return to the Creative Cloud desktop app. Your authentication issue should now be resolved. [Image] Use the Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps!
